Reason: The 'key_cache_size_in_mb' configuration in the Cassandra software project is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the memory consumption and read performance of the system. Increasing the key cache size can improve read performance by reducing the number of disk reads, while decreasing it can lead to increased disk I/O and slower read operations. Therefore, changes in the 'key_cache_size_in_mb' value can significantly affect the overall system performance.
